class_notes: Prerequisites: This course is an elective for Epidemiology PhD students and is open to PhD students from other departments only with instructor permission.  Prior or concurrent enrollment in EPI 760/BIOS 76 is required. Course Description: This course covers a wide variety of selected topics in study design, analysis and causal inference. Fundamental concepts to be covered include: relationships between observational and observable probabilities and links between nonparametric structural equation models and directed acyclic graphs;  equivalence of exchangeability and identification of certain causal effects;  maximum likelihood estimation and a conceptual approach to use of estimating equations; application of instrumental variables and negative controls and identification of causal effects using them; study designs, including difference in difference studies, regression discontinuity and interrupted time series studies; and a conceptual approach to graphical representation of the pattern of a causal effects and the G-formula.
course_description: Covers a wide variety of topics in epidemiologic methodology. Topics will include basic epidemiologic measures, confounding, misclassification, selection bias, types of case-control studies, Berkson of epidemiologic parameters. Prerequisite: EPI 530, EPI 534, BIOS 500, BIOS 501 (EPI 534 and BIOS 501 may be taken concurrently). Doctoral student section.
